    <us-gaap:BusinessDescriptionAndBasisOfPresentationTextBlock 
contextRef="From2013-04-01to2013-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Green River Resources Corp. (an
Alberta, Canada&#13;corporation) (&amp;#147;GRC&amp;#148;), formed on December 
1, 2004, and its wholly owned subsidiary, Green River Resources, Inc. (a 
Utah&#13;corporation) (&amp;#147;GRI&amp;#148;), formed on February 16, 2005, 
were formed for the purpose of extracting oil from oil sands, oil&#13;shale, and
other similar types of naturally occurring hydrocarbons in a cost effective and 
environmentally safe manner. GRC completed&#13;a merger with American Sands 
Energy Corp. (formerly Millstream Ventures, Inc.) (&amp;#147;ASEC&amp;#148;), a 
publicly traded company,&#13;on June 3, 2011. The merger was accounted for as a 
reverse acquisition with GRC treated as the accounting 
acquirer.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On December 31, 2011, GRC, a 
wholly owned non-operating&#13;subsidiary of ASEC, was voluntarily dissolved 
under the Business Corporation Act of the Province of Alberta, Canada. As a 
result&#13;of the dissolution, ASEC assumed all of the outstanding stock of GRI 
which was the sole asset of GRC at the time of dissolution.&#13;References to 
the &amp;#147;Company&amp;#148; refer to GRC and its wholly owned subsidiary, 
GRI, prior to the reverse merger on June&#13;3, 2011, and GRC, GRI, and ASEC 
(the legal parent) subsequent to the reverse merger transaction until December 
31, 2011, and GRI&#13;and ASEC after December 31, 2011. The Company has not 
generated revenues from its principal operations and is a development 
stage&#13;company.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The 
Company has acquired rights to approximately&#13;1,760 acres of prime oil sand 
deposits in the Sunnyside area of Utah. Prior to January 24, 2012, the Company 
had licensed proprietary&#13;extraction technology with Bleeding Rock, LLC 
(&amp;#147;Bleeding Rock&amp;#148;), which had an exclusive license to a bitumen
and hydrocarbon&#13;extraction process to separate oil and other hydrocarbons 
from sand, dirt and other substances. Bleeding Rock is a 
significant&#13;stockholder of the Company and is 50% owned in combination among
the Chief Executive Officer of the Company and two of his 
relatives.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Effective 
January 24, 2012, the Company entered&#13;into a License, Development and 
Engineering Agreement with Universal Oil Recovery Corp. and SRS International 
(the &amp;#147;License&#13;Agreement&amp;#148;) whereby the Company was granted 
an exclusive non-transferable license to use certain technology in its 
proposed&#13;business to extract bitumen from oil sands. The territory covered 
by the agreement includes the State of Utah and any other 
geographic&#13;location in which a future designated project is commenced by or 
through the Company. In conjunction with the License Agreement,&#13;the Company 
terminated its operating agreement with Bleeding Rock under which Bleeding Rock 
had licensed rights to use similar&#13;technology to GRI. The License Agreement 
also designates the Company as an &amp;#147;authorized agent&amp;#148; in 
representing the owner&#13;of the technology in future projects. The Chief
Executive Officer, a director, and principal stockholder of the Company, is 
an&#13;owner and manager of Bleeding Rock.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font:
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The License Agreement requires 
the licensing&#13;parties to provide demonstration equipment for the process by 
which their proprietary solvent extracts bitumen from oil sands and&#13;to 
demonstrate the process on up to 150 tons of oil sands. The term of the License 
Agreement is for 20 years and thereafter so&#13;long as production of products 
using the technology is commercially and economically feasible.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:BusinessDescriptionAndBasisOfPresentationTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:SignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock contextRef="From2013-04-
01to2013-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0;
text-align: justify"&gt;These financial statements have been prepared&#13;by the
Company in accordance with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles 
(&amp;#147;US GAAP&amp;#148;) for interim financial information,&#13;as well as 
the instructions to Form 10-Q. Accordingly, they do not include all of the 
information and notes required by US GAAP&#13;for complete financial statements.
In the opinion of the Company&amp;#146;s management, all adjustments (consisting
solely of normal&#13;recurring adjustments) considered necessary for a fair 
presentation of the interim financial statements have been 
included.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The preparation of financial 
statements in conformity&#13;with US GAAP requires management to make judgments,
estimates, and assumptions that could affect the reported amounts of 
assets&#13;and liabilities at the date of the financial statements and the 
reported amounts of revenues and expenses during the reporting&#13;period. 
Actual results could differ significantly from those 
estimates.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;a) Principles of 
Consolidation&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The condensed consolidated 
financial statements&#13;include the consolidated operations of GRC through June
3, 2011, the consolidated operations of GRC and ASEC from June 3, 
2011&#13;through the GRC dissolution on December 31, 2011 and the consolidated 
operations of ASEC and GRI through June 30, 2013. All 
significant&#13;intercompany balances and transactions have been eliminated in 
consolidation.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;b) Mineral 
Leases&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In certain cases, the Company 
capitalizes costs&#13;related to investments in mineral lease interests on a 
property-by-property basis. Such costs include mineral lease 
acquisition&#13;costs. Costs are deferred until such time as the extent of 
proved developed reserves has been determined and mineral lease 
interests&#13;are either developed, the property sold or the mineral lease 
rights are allowed to lapse. To date, all exploration and lease costs&#13;have 
been expensed.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;c) Research and 
Development&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman,
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent:
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company continues to 
develop additional&#13;technology related to its licensed proprietary bitumen 
extraction process. To date, the Company has expensed costs associated 
with&#13;developing its technology as research and development expenses. For the
three months ended June 30, 2013 and 2012, the Company&#13;incurred costs of 
$49,042 and $79,909, respectively, for research and development of its 
technology.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;d) Stock-based 
Compensation&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company uses the Black-
Scholes option-pricing&#13;model to determine the fair value of stock options 
and warrants granted. For employee stock options, the Company records the grant-
date&#13;fair value as expense over the period in which it is earned, typically 
the vesting period. For consultants, the fair value of the&#13;stock-based award
is recorded as expense over the term of the service period, and unvested amounts
are revalued using the Black-Scholes&#13;model at each reporting period. For 
warrants issued to lenders, the Company records the grant-date fair value of the
warrants,&#13;and any resulting beneficial conversion feature for convertible 
debt, as a note discount. The discount is then amortized over the&#13;term of 
the convertible debt as non-cash interest expense.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; 
text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;e) 
Earnings or Loss Per Common Share&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; 
text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Basic earnings
or loss per common share is computed&#13;on the basis of the weighted average 
number of shares outstanding during the periods. Diluted earnings or loss per 
common share&#13;is calculated on the basis of the weighted average number of 
common shares outstanding during the period plus the effect of 
potential&#13;dilutive shares during the period. Potential dilutive shares 
include outstanding stock options and warrants and convertible 
debt&#13;instruments. For periods in which a net loss is reported, potential 
dilutive shares are excluded because they are antidilutive.&#13;Therefore, basic
loss per common share is the same as diluted loss per common share for the three
months ended June 30, 2013 and&#13;2012.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;f) Recent Accounting 
Pronouncements&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In July 2012, the Financial 
Accounting Standards&#13;Board (&amp;#147;FASB&amp;#148;) Accounting Standards 
Update (&amp;#147;ASU&amp;#148;) 2012-02, &lt;i&gt;Intangibles-Goodwill and 
Other (Topic350):&#13;Testing Indefinite-Lived Intangible Assets for Impairment.
&lt;/i&gt;This ASU permits an entity the option to first assess 
qualitative&#13;factors to determine whether it is more-likely-than-not that an 
indefinite-lived intangible asset is impaired. If the qualitative&#13;assessment
supports the conclusion that it is more-likely-than-not that the fair value of 
the asset exceeds its carrying amount,&#13;the entity would not need to perform 
the two-step quantitative impairment test. The focus of the guidance is to 
reduce the cost&#13;and complexity of performing impairment tests for 
indefinite-lived intangible assets other than goodwill, and to improve 
consistency&#13;in impairment testing among long-lived asset categories. This 
ASU is effective for annual and interim impairment tests performed&#13;prior to 
the issuance of the final ASU, if an entity&amp;#146;s financial statements for
the most recent annual or interim period&#13;have not yet been issued. This ASU 
did not have a material impact on the Company&amp;#146;s consolidated financial 
statements.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In October 2012, the FASB 
issued ASU 2012-04,&#13;&lt;i&gt;Technical Corrections and 
Improvements&lt;/i&gt;. The amendments in this update cover a wide range of 
Topics in the ASC. These amendments&#13;include technical corrections and 
improvements to the ASC and conforming amendments related to fair value 
measurements. The amendments&#13;in this update were effective for fiscal 
periods beginning after December 15, 2012. The adoption of ASU 2012-04 did not 
have a&#13;material impact on the Company&amp;#146;s consolidated financial 
statements.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:SignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:LiquidityDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2013-04-01to2013-06-
30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align:
justify"&gt;The Company&amp;#146;s financial statements have&#13;been prepared 
assuming the Company is a going concern which contemplates the realization of 
assets and the liquidation of liabilities&#13;in the ordinary course of 
business. The Company has incurred substantial losses from operations, has 
negative working capital,&#13;and has negative cash flows from operating 
activities, which raise substantial doubt about the Company&amp;#146;s ability 
to continue&#13;as a going concern. The Company sustained a net loss for the 
three months ended June 30, 2013 of $483,077 and has an accumulated&#13;deficit 
of $11,681,929 as of June 30, 2013. In addition, the Company estimates it will 
require approximately $60,000,000 in capital&#13;to commence its principal 
operations.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company intends to continue
its research&#13;and development efforts, but does not have revenues from which 
to finance these activities internally. As a result, the Company&#13;intends to 
seek financing in order to fund its operations.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; 
text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company 
has been able to meet its short-term&#13;needs primarily through loans from 
third parties, private placements of equity and debt securities, and deferring 
certain payment&#13;obligations to related parties.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The 
Company is actively seeking additional private and public placements of equity 
securities.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;font style="color: black"&gt;The&#13;Company 
plans to continue to obtain financing through the sale of equity or debt 
securities in order to finance operations until&#13;it can generate positive 
cash flows from operating activities. &lt;/font&gt;The private and public equity
placements are expected to&#13;provide the needed funds for continued operations
and further research and development of the Company&amp;#146;s proprietary oil 
sands&#13;refining methods. The Company can provide no assurance that it will be
able to obtain sufficient additional financing needed to&#13;develop its 
technology and alleviate doubt about its ability to continue as a going concern.
To the extent the Company raises additional&#13;funds by issuing equity 
securities, the Company&amp;#146;s stockholders may experience significant 
dilution. Any debt financing, if&#13;available, may involve restrictive 
covenants that impact the Company&amp;#146;s ability to conduct business. The 
condensed consolidated&#13;financial statements do not include any adjustments 
that might result from the outcome of this uncertainty.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:LiquidityDisclosureTextBlock>

    <us-gaap:MineralIndustriesDisclosuresTextBlock contextRef="From2013-04-
01to2013-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0;
text-align: justify"&gt;During 2005, the Company acquired three oil&#13;sands 
mineral leases: (1) an undivided 40% interest in an 1,120-acre parcel, (2) an 
undivided 20% interest in the same 1,120-acre&#13;parcel, and (3) an undivided 
16.666% interest in a 640-acre parcel. These leases are located in Carbon 
County, Utah, have a 6-year&#13;life, and require minimum yearly lease payments 
totaling $224,597. Effective March 31, 2013, the lease terms were extended 
through&#13;2016 and the annual lease payments increased to 
$268,915.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In 2009, a fourth lease was 
entered into with&#13;William G. Gibbs, a relative of the Chief Executive 
Officer of the Company, for an additional undivided 5% interest in the 640-
acre&#13;parcel (for a total 21.666% undivided interest in the 640-acre parcel).
This lease is located in Carbon County, Utah, adjacent&#13;to the 1,120-acre 
parcel. This lease has a 6-year life with a minimum yearly lease payment of 
$7,965 and is scheduled to terminate&#13;by October 2015 if the property has not
reached commercial production. Effective March 31, 2013, the payment due date 
for this&#13;lease was extended to July 31, 2013 from January 1, 2013. 
Effective, July 31, 2013, the lease payment was extended again 
until&#13;September 30, 2013.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company&amp;#146;s interest
in these leases&#13;is conditioned upon the payments of royalties, minimum 
yearly investment in development, tax payments, and other obligations to&#13;the
owners of the leases.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman,
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Upon 
commencement of operations, each lease&#13;requires a production royalty of 10% 
of the market value of the minerals sold, net of applicable costs and expenses. 
The Company&#13;has the right, but not the obligation, to pool or unitize the 
leases, such that the ore mined is allocated between, and the 
royalties&#13;paid, on their proportionate interests. If not pooled, the owners 
will be paid royalties only to the extent the oil sand ore is&#13;mined on their
respective property. Through June 30, 2013, no production royalties were accrued
or paid because production on these&#13;properties had not commenced. After
three consecutive calendar years of production on the 1,120-acre parcel, the 
production royalty&#13;on the 1,120-acre parcel shall be the greater of the 10% 
royalty or $1,000,000 annually.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Future minimum lease payments 
are as follows&#13;for the years ending:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0"

gaap:MineralIndustriesDisclosuresTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:DebtDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2013-04-01to2013-06-
30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align:
justify"&gt;As a result of the reverse merger, the Company&#13;assumed 
convertible notes payable of $770,000 on June 3, 2011. In addition, the Company 
has issued $745,000 of convertible notes&#13;payable subsequent to the reverse 
merger. These notes were issued pursuant to a $1,750,000 private offering. As of
June 30, 2013,&#13;there was $1,515,000 of convertible notes payable outstanding
with accrued interest of $298,819. This offering was closed by the&#13;Company 
effective January 31, 2013.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman,
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The notes bear interest at 10% 
per annum and&#13;all principal and interest are due and payable by April 30, 
2014. The notes and all accrued interest are convertible into the 
Company&amp;#146;s&#13;common stock at any time by the lender at approximately 
$0.50 per common share until the due date. The notes automatically 
convert&#13;upon completion of a financing of $10,000,000 or 
more.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In connection with the terms of
the offering,&#13;holders of the notes also received 100,286 warrants for each 
$50,000 loaned to the Company. Through June 30, 2013, the Company&#13;granted 
3,038,667 warrants in connection with this offering (see Note 9). The Company 
recorded a debt discount related to the warrants&#13;and resulting beneficial 
conversion feature of $873,589. The unamortized debt discount was $273,660 and 
$352,317 as of June 30,&#13;2013 and March 31, 2013, respectively. For the 
warrants issued, the Company valued the warrant discount using the Black-
Scholes&#13;pricing model with the following weighted average 
assumptions:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0" style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 100%;

Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In June 2013, 
the Company borrowed a combined&#13;$150,000 from three individuals. The notes 
bear interest at 6%, are due by June 30, 2014 and are convertible into the 
Company&amp;#146;s&#13;common stock at the same rate as the Company completes a 
future offering of $2,000,000 or more.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:DebtDisclosureTextBlock>
    <AMSE:ConvertibleNotePayableRelatedPartyTextBlock contextRef="From2013-04-
01to2013-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0;
text-align: justify"&gt;On May 31, 2011, the Company converted $214,281&#13;of 
its outstanding payable to Bleeding Rock into a 6% convertible promissory note. 
The note is convertible into 535,704 shares&#13;of the Company&amp;#146;s common
stock. Effective January 1, 2013, the Company modified the terms of the note 
such that all of the&#13;outstanding principal which totaled $214,281 and 
accrued interest which totaled $20,712 was converted into a new note 
totaling&#13;$234,993 that is non-interest bearing. The Company imputed interest
on the new note using a discount rate of 6% and recorded a&#13;debt discount of 
$18,006 which is being amortized over the remaining life of the loan using the 
interest method. As of June 30,&#13;2013 and March 31, 2013, the carrying 
balance of the note was $223,539 and $220,221, respectively, net of the 
unamortized remaining&#13;discount. Effective January 1, 2013, the note was 
modified and the due date was extended to April 30, 
2014.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Effective January 24, 2012, the
Company entered&#13;into a Termination Agreement with Bleeding Rock (the 
&amp;#147;Termination Agreement&amp;#148;). The purpose of the agreement was 
to&#13;terminate the Operating Agreement dated May 31, 2005, as amended, between
Bleeding Rock and GRI (the &amp;#147;Operating 
Agreement&amp;#148;).&#13;Pursuant to the Operating Agreement, GRI had obtained 
the rights through Bleeding Rock to utilize a process for the 
development,&#13;engineering and extraction of hydrocarbons from oil sands. In 
light of conversations with potential investors, the Company determined&#13;that
having the technology licensed directly to the Company (rather than through 
Bleeding Rock and the Operating Agreement) would&#13;be beneficial to fund 
raising prospects.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Effective on the date of 
termination, Bleeding&#13;Rock assigned its interest in the note to Hidden Peak 
Partners LLC (&amp;#147;Hidden Peak&amp;#148;), a related party who is the 
majority&#13;owner of Bleeding Rock. Contemporaneous with the execution of the 
License Agreement and the Termination Agreement described above,&#13;the Company
entered into a Gross Royalty Agreement with Bleeding Rock whereby the Company is
obligated to pay a royalty equal to&#13;1.5% of the gross receipts from future 
projects using the technology, excluding the current project in Sunnyside, Utah.
The Gross&#13;Royalty Agreement was similarly assigned to Hidden 
Peak.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="color: 
black"&gt;As of the date of&#13;the Termination Agreement, GRI owed $1,446,551 
to Bleeding Rock, payable under the terms of the Operating Agreement. In 
connection&#13;with the termination of the Operating Agreement, GRI issued a 5% 
convertible promissory note to Bleeding Rock for this amount.&#13;Initially, the
note was due one year from the date of the note. The note was subsequently 
modified and is currently due and payable&#13;on April 30, 2014 and is 
convertible into shares of the Company&amp;#146;s common stock any time before 
maturity at the rate of one&#13;share for each $0.50 of principal or interest 
converted. &lt;/font&gt;Effective January 1, 2013, the Company further modified 
the terms&#13;of the note such that all of the outstanding principal, which 
totaled $1,446,551, and accrued interest, which totaled $67,965,&#13;were 
converted into a new note totaling $1,514,516 that is non-interest bearing. The 
Company imputed interest on the new note using&#13;a discount rate of 6% and 
recorded a debt discount of $116,047 which is being amortized over the remaining
life of the loan using&#13;the interest method. As of June 30, 2013 and March 
31, 2013, the carrying balance of the note was $1,440,700 and $1,419,311, 
respectively,&#13;net of the unamortized remaining discount. The note is due 
April 30, 2014.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman,
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In January 2013, the Company 
borrowed $74,000&#13;from C-14 Strategies, a company controlled by the 
Company&amp;#146;s President. The note bears interest at 6% and is due and 
payable&#13;by the earlier of June 30, 2014 or when the Company completes a 
$2,000,000 equity or debt bridge financing transaction. The note&#13;is 
convertible into common stock of the Company upon completion of a bridge 
financing transaction at the same price and terms as&#13;the bridge financing. 
As of June 30, 2013 and March 31, 2013, the carrying value of the note was 
$75,849 and $74,742 including&#13;accrued interest of $1,849 and $742, 
respectively.&lt;/p&gt;</AMSE:ConvertibleNotePayableRelatedPartyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:StockholdersEquityNoteDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2013-04-
01to2013-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0;
text-align: justify"&gt;In March 2012, the Company initiated a 
private&#13;placement to raise an aggregate maximum of $7,000,000 through the 
sale of up to 140 units at $50,000 per unit. Each unit is composed&#13;of 43,478
shares of common stock and two-year warrants to purchase another 10,870 shares 
of common stock at $1.15 per share. As&#13;of June 30, 2013, the Company had 
sold 1,089,781 shares of common stock under the private placement agreement 
resulting in gross&#13;proceeds of $1,253,248. As more fully described in Note 
9, the Company issued 272,402 warrants in connection with this 
private&#13;placement.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:StockholdersEquityNoteDisclosureTextBlock>

warrants.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times,

 style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;The weighted average grant-date fair value of&#13;options granted 
during the three months ended June 30, 2012 was $1.09.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify;

and exercisable options presented&#13;by price range as of June 30, 2013 are as

Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The estimated 
fair value of the Company&amp;#146;s&#13;stock options, less expected 
forfeitures, is amortized over the options&amp;#146; vesting period on the 
straight-line basis. The Company&#13;recognized $44,727 and $174,596 of equity-
based compensation expenses during the three months ended June 30, 2013 and 
2012, respectively.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman,

Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;As of June 30, 2013, there was 
$176,554 of total&#13;unrecognized compensation cost with a weighted-average 
vesting period of approximately 1.00 year.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p

gaap:ShareholdersEquityAndShareBasedPaymentsTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:CommitmentsDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2013-04-01to2013-06-
30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align:
justify"&gt;Effective January 1, 2013, the Company modified&#13;its employment 
contract with the Chief Executive Officer. Pursuant to the terms of the 
modification, the CEO&amp;#146;s salary was&#13;reduced from $400,000 per year 
to $276,000 per year. In addition, the CEO&amp;#146;s salary will accrue until 
the Company has raised&#13;$2,000,000 in a debt or equity financing. At the time
the financing is completed, the CEO will receive four months of accrued 
salary&#13;and will begin to be paid monthly. Any remaining unpaid salary in 
excess of four months&amp;#146; salary will be converted to common&#13;stock 
under the same terms once the Company has completed a $5,000,000 or more raise. 
Upon completion of a $10,000,000 or more&#13;financing, the CEO&amp;#146;s 
salary will increase back to $400,000. Unpaid salary from 2011 and prior will be
converted to common&#13;stock of the Company at $0.50 per share upon the Company
closing a financing of $10,000,000 or more. The CEO has also agreed 
to&#13;consult with an accountant or attorney specializing in taxes, and if 
taxes which may become due in connection with the conversion&#13;of such amounts
can be deferred until a sale of such shares the CEO will convert such shares at 
such time. All other terms of the&#13;employment agreement remained the same. 
The term of the employment agreement is in effect through December 31, 2015. As 
of June&#13;30, 2013 and March 31, 2013, the total accrued commitment was 
$1,049,350 and $1,070,788, respectively which is included as 
accrued&#13;expenses and selling, general and administrative expenses in the 
accompanying consolidated financial statements.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; 
text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On March 31, 
2011, the Company entered into&#13;an employment agreement with the Chief 
Operating Officer, replacing all previous employment agreements, that provides 
for initial&#13;compensation at an hourly rate of $175 and expense 
reimbursements. Upon the completion of a financing by the Company of not 
less&#13;than $10,000,000, his compensation will increase to $300,000 annually 
plus all other benefits normally provided to an employee.&#13;This employment 
agreement terminates March 31, 2014.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On February 16, 2012, the 
Company entered into&#13;an employment agreement with the President. The 
agreement is terminable by either party upon 30 days&amp;#146; notice. Pursuant 
to&#13;the terms of the agreement, the President will be entitled to a base 
salary of $240,000 per year upon the first successful fundraising&#13;by the 
Company of at least $5,000,000 in equity or convertible securities (the 
&amp;#147;Financing Event&amp;#148;).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Upon completion of the 
Financing Event, he will&#13;also receive 5-year options to purchase 400,000 
shares of the Company&amp;#146;s common stock. The options will vest 50% upon 
the&#13;Financing Event and 50% upon the completion of a total of $40,000,000 in
equity or debt financing during the term of the agreement.&#13;The options will 
have an exercise price equal to the price per share, or per share equivalent, of
the Financing Event. Under his&#13;employment agreement, the President is 
entitled to receive an annual bonus of up to $240,000, at the discretion of the 
board, to&#13;be paid on or before December 15&lt;sup&gt;th&lt;/sup&gt; of each 
year. As of June 30, 2013, the Financing Event had not been 
successfully&#13;completed and the agreement has not been 
renewed.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The consulting agreement dated 
October 1, 2011,&#13;between the Company and C14 Strategy (the 
&amp;#147;Consulting Agreement&amp;#148;), an entity controlled by the
President, will remain&#13;in force until a Financing Event at which time it 
will be immediately terminate. Pursuant to the Consulting Agreement, C14 
Strategy&#13;provides assistance with respect to strategic objectives of the 
Company. As compensation for such services, C14 Strategy is paid&#13;$10,000 per
month. The contract is terminable any time on 60 days&amp;#146; notice, or by 
mutual consent.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Under his employment agreement,
the Chief Financial&#13;Officer is entitled to receive an annual bonus of up to 
$120,000, at the discretion of the Board, to be paid on or before 
December&#13;15&lt;sup&gt;th&lt;/sup&gt; of each year. Effective January 1, 
2013, the CFO&amp;#146;s employment agreement was modified and his annual 
salary&#13;was increased to $175,000. The salary will be accrued until the 
Company completes a debt or equity fund raising of $2,000,000 
or&#13;more.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:CommitmentsDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:SubsequentEventsTextBlock contextRef="From2013-04-01to2013-06-
30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align:
justify"&gt;On July 1, 2013, the Company entered into a&#13;consulting contact 
with Great Bear, LLC (&amp;#147;Great Bear&amp;#148;) to provide corporate 
advisory and marketing services to the&#13;Company. The contract calls for the 
Company to issue Great Bear 100,000 shares of restricted common stock as 
consideration for&#13;the services to be provided and to pay a one-time $5,000 
fee upon completion of an offering of at least $2,000,000. The term of&#13;the 
agreement is for one year.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Effective July 11, 2013, the 
Company entered&#13;into a financial advisory agreement with Merriman Capital, 
Inc. (&amp;#34;Merriman&amp;#34;), a wholly owned subsidiary of Merriman 
Holdings,&#13;Inc. (OTCQX: MERR). The Agreement is for a 12 month period and the
Company has agreed to issue to Merriman 300,000 shares of restricted&#13;common 
stock in consideration of its services. Under the Agreement, Merriman will 
advise the Company on strategic initiatives to&#13;increase shareholder value, 
analyze the Company&amp;#146;s operating projections and market conditions and 
provide the Company with&#13;recommendations for the proper positioning of the 
Company with potential investors. Merriman will also assist the Company in 
raising&#13;its next round of capital. The Company has agreed that Merriman will
have unlimited &amp;#34;piggyback&amp;#34; registration rights for&#13;a period 
of three years after the issuance of the shares at the Company's expense 
(provided that such rights shall not apply to&#13;a public offering of the 
Company&amp;#146;s common stock upon any underwriter&amp;#146;s reasonable 
assertion in writing that the inclusion&#13;of such stock in a public offering 
would materially impair the marketability of such public 
offering).&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In 
conjunction with the proposed fund raising&#13;by Merriman, Hidden Peak Partners
LLC has agreed to subordinate any debt owed to Hidden Peak by the Company to any
future debt&#13;financing by the Company. Hidden Peak has also agreed in 
principal to convert its 5% Convertible Promissory Note dated January&#13;24, 
2012, into restricted common shares of the Company pursuant to the terms of such
Note, subject to satisfactory tax analysis&#13;that no federal or state income 
tax would be triggered on conversion of such note.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; 
text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Neither the 
shares proposed to be issued to&#13;Merriman nor to Hidden Peak have been 
registered under the Securities Act and may not be offered or sold in the United
States absent&#13;registration or an applicable exemption from registration 
requirements.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman,
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Effective July 11, 2013, the 
Company issued&#13;each of its nonexecutive directors options to purchase 
125,000 shares of common stock pursuant to the Company&amp;#146;s 2011 
Plan.&#13;The exercise price of the options will be $0.35 and the options expire
five years from the date of grant and vest 1/3 on the date&#13;of grant, 1/3 on 
the first anniversary date and 1/3 on the 2&lt;sup&gt;nd&lt;/sup&gt; anniversary
date.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On July 11, 2013, the Company 
issued to its&#13;Chief Operating Officer an option to purchase 185,000 shares 
of the Company&amp;#146;s common stock pursuant to the 
Company&amp;#146;s&#13;2011 Plan. The exercise price of the options will be 
$0.35 and the options expire five years from the date of grant and vest 
1/3&#13;on the date of grant, 1/3 on the first anniversary date and 1/3 on the 
2&lt;sup&gt;nd&lt;/sup&gt; anniversary date.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:SubsequentEventsTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:ConsolidationPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2013-04-01to2013-06-
30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align:
justify"&gt;The condensed consolidated financial statements&#13;include the 
consolidated operations of GRC through June 3, 2011, the consolidated operations
of GRC and ASEC from June 3, 2011&#13;through the GRC dissolution on December 
31, 2011 and the consolidated operations of ASEC and GRI through June 30, 2013. 
All significant&#13;intercompany balances and transactions have been eliminated 
in consolidation.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:ConsolidationPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:RevenueRecognitionLeases contextRef="From2013-04-01to2013-06-
30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align:
justify"&gt;In certain cases, the Company capitalizes costs&#13;related to 
investments in mineral lease interests on a property-by-property basis. Such 
costs include mineral lease acquisition&#13;costs. Costs are deferred until such
time as the extent of proved developed reserves has been determined and mineral 
lease interests&#13;are either developed, the property sold or the mineral lease
rights are allowed to lapse. To date, all exploration and lease costs&#13;have 
been expensed.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:RevenueRecognitionLeases>
    <us-gaap:ResearchAndDevelopmentExpensePolicy contextRef="From2013-04-
01to2013-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0;
text-align: justify"&gt;The Company continues to develop 
additional&#13;technology related to its licensed proprietary bitumen extraction
process. To date, the Company has expensed costs associated with&#13;developing 
its technology as research and development expenses. For the three months ended 
June 30, 2013 and 2012, the Company&#13;incurred costs of $49,042 and $79,909, 
respectively, for research and development of its technology.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:ResearchAndDevelopmentExpensePolicy>
    <us-gaap:ShareBasedCompensationOptionAndIncentivePlansPolicy 
contextRef="From2013-04-01to2013-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company uses the Black-
Scholes option-pricing&#13;model to determine the fair value of stock options 
and warrants granted. For employee stock options, the Company records the grant-
date&#13;fair value as expense over the period in which it is earned, typically 
the vesting period. For consultants, the fair value of the&#13;stock-based award
is recorded as expense over the term of the service period, and unvested amounts
are revalued using the Black-Scholes&#13;model at each reporting period. For 
warrants issued to lenders, the Company records the grant-date fair value of the
warrants,&#13;and any resulting beneficial conversion feature for convertible 
debt, as a note discount. The discount is then amortized over the&#13;term of 
the convertible debt as non-cash interest expense.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:ShareBasedCompensationOptionAndIncentivePlansPolicy>
    <us-gaap:EarningsPerSharePolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2013-04-01to2013-
06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-
align: justify"&gt;Basic earnings or loss per common share is computed&#13;on 
the basis of the weighted average number of shares outstanding during the 
periods. Diluted earnings or loss per common share&#13;is calculated on the 
basis of the weighted average number of common shares outstanding during the 
period plus the effect of potential&#13;dilutive shares during the period.
Potential dilutive shares include outstanding stock options and warrants and 
convertible debt&#13;instruments. For periods in which a net loss is reported, 
potential dilutive shares are excluded because they are 
antidilutive.&#13;Therefore, basic loss per common share is the same as diluted 
loss per common share for the three months ended June 30, 2013 
and&#13;2012.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:EarningsPerSharePolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:NewAccountingPronouncementsPolicyPolicyTextBlock 
contextRef="From2013-04-01to2013-06-30">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In July 2012, the Financial 
Accounting Standards&#13;Board (&amp;#147;FASB&amp;#148;) Accounting Standards 
Update (&amp;#147;ASU&amp;#148;) 2012-02, &lt;i&gt;Intangibles-Goodwill and 
Other (Topic350):&#13;Testing Indefinite-Lived Intangible Assets for Impairment.
&lt;/i&gt;This ASU permits an entity the option to first assess 
qualitative&#13;factors to determine whether it is more-likely-than-not that an 
indefinite-lived intangible asset is impaired. If the qualitative&#13;assessment
supports the conclusion that it is more-likely-than-not that the fair value of 
the asset exceeds its carrying amount,&#13;the entity would not need to perform 
the two-step quantitative impairment test. The focus of the guidance is to 
reduce the cost&#13;and complexity of performing impairment tests for 
indefinite-lived intangible assets other than goodwill, and to improve 
consistency&#13;in impairment testing among long-lived asset categories. This 
ASU is effective for annual and interim impairment tests performed&#13;prior to 
the issuance of the final ASU, if an entity&amp;#146;s financial statements for 
the most recent annual or interim period&#13;have not yet been issued. This ASU 
did not have a material impact on the Company&amp;#146;s consolidated financial 
statements.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In October 2012, the FASB 
issued ASU 2012-04,&#13;&lt;i&gt;Technical Corrections and 
Improvements&lt;/i&gt;. The amendments in this update cover a wide range of 
Topics in the ASC. These amendments&#13;include technical corrections and 
improvements to the ASC and conforming amendments related to fair value 
measurements. The amendments&#13;in this update were effective for fiscal 
periods beginning after December 15, 2012. The adoption of ASU 2012-04 did not 
have a&#13;material impact on the Company&amp;#146;s consolidated financial 
statements.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:NewAccountingPronouncementsPolicyPolicyTextBlock>

    <us-
gaap:ScheduleOfShareBasedCompensationSharesAuthorizedUnderStockOptionPlansByExer
cisePriceRangeTextBlock contextRef="From2013-04-01to2013-06-30">&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;Outstanding and exercisable options presented&#13;by price range as 
of June 30, 2013 are as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0"

ZeroAsNone>false</DisplayZeroAsNone><NumericAmount>0</NumericAmount><RoundedNume
ricAmount>0</RoundedNumericAmount><NonNumbericText>&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The 
Company&amp;#146;s financial statements have
been prepared assuming the Company is a going concern which contemplates the 
realization of assets and the liquidation of liabilities
in the ordinary course of business. The Company has incurred substantial losses 
from operations, has negative working capital,
and has negative cash flows from operating activities, which raise substantial 
doubt about the Company&amp;#146;s ability to continue
as a going concern. The Company sustained a net loss for the three months ended 
June 30, 2013 of $483,077 and has an accumulated
deficit of $11,681,929 as of June 30, 2013. In addition, the Company estimates 
it will require approximately $60,000,000 in capital
to commence its principal operations.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;The Company intends to continue its research
and development efforts, but does not have revenues from which to finance these 
activities internally. As a result, the Company
intends to seek financing in order to fund its operations.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;The Company has been able to meet its short-term
needs primarily through loans from third parties, private placements of equity 
and debt securities, and deferring certain payment
obligations to related parties.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The Company is actively 
seeking additional private and public placements of equity 
securities.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;font style="color: black"&gt;The
Company plans to continue to obtain financing through the sale of equity or debt
securities in order to finance operations until
it can generate positive cash flows from operating activities. &lt;/font&gt;The 
private and public equity placements are expected to
provide the needed funds for continued operations and further research and 
development of the Company&amp;#146;s proprietary oil sands
refining methods. The Company can provide no assurance that it will be able to 
obtain sufficient additional financing needed to
develop its technology and alleviate doubt about its ability to continue as a 
going concern. To the extent the Company raises additional
funds by issuing equity securities, the Company&amp;#146;s stockholders may 
experience significant dilution. Any debt financing, if
available, may involve restrictive covenants that impact the Company&amp;#146;s 
ability to conduct business. The condensed consolidated
financial statements do not include any adjustments that might result from the 
outcome of this uncertainty.&lt;/p&gt;</NonNumbericText><FootnoteIndexer 
/><CurrencyCode /><CurrencySymbol 
/><IsIndependantCurrency>false</IsIndependantCurrency><ShowCurrencySymbol>false<
/ShowCurrencySymbol><DisplayDateInUSFormat>false</DisplayDateInUSFormat></Cell><
/Cells><ElementDataType>nonnum:textBlockItemType</ElementDataType><SimpleDataTyp
e>na</SimpleDataType><ElementDefenition>Disclosure of accounting policy for 
reporting when there is a substantial doubt about an entity's ability to 
continue as a going concern for a reasonable period of time (generally a year 
from the balance sheet date). Disclose: (a) pertinent conditions and events 
giving rise to the assessment of substantial doubt about the entity's ability to
continue as a going concern for a reasonable period of time, (b) the possible 
effects of such conditions and events, (c) management's evaluation of the 
significance of those conditions and events and any mitigating factors, (d) 
possible discontinuance of operations, (e) management's plans (including 
relevant prospective financial information), and (f) information about the 
recoverability or classification of recorded asset amounts or the amounts or 
classification of liabilities. If management's plans alleviate the substantial 
doubt about the entity's ability to continue as a going concern, disclosure of 
the principal conditions and events that initially raised the substantial doubt 
about the entity's ability to continue as a going concern would be expected to 
be considered. Disclose whether operations for the current or prior years 
generated sufficient cash to cover current obligations, whether waivers were 
obtained from creditors relating to the company's default under the provisions 
of debt agreements and possible effects of such conditions and events, such as: 
whether there is a possible need to obtain additional financing (debt or equity)
or to liquidate certain holdings to offset future cash flow deficiencies. 
Disclose appropriate parent company information when parent is dependent upon 
remittances from subsidiaries to satisfy its 
obligations.</ElementDefenition><ElementReferences>No definition 
available.</ElementReferences><IsTotalLabel>false</IsTotalLabel><UnitID>0</UnitI
D><Label>Note 3 - Going Concern</Label></Row></Rows><Footnotes 
/><IsEquityReport>false</IsEquityReport><ReportName>3. Going 
Concern</ReportName><MonetaryRoundingLevel>UnKnown</MonetaryRoundingLevel><Share
sRoundingLevel>UnKnown</SharesRoundingLevel><PerShareRoundingLevel>UnKnown</PerS
hareRoundingLevel><ExchangeRateRoundingLevel>UnKnown</ExchangeRateRoundingLevel>
<HasCustomUnits>true</HasCustomUnits><IsEmbedReport>false</IsEmbedReport><IsMult
iCurrency>false</IsMultiCurrency><ReportType>Sheet</ReportType><RoleURI>http://a
mericansands.com/role/GoingConcern</RoleURI><NumberOfCols>1</NumberOfCols><Numbe
rOfRows>2</NumberOfRows></InstanceReport>
</XBRL>

/Cells><ElementDataType>xbrli:stringItemType</ElementDataType><SimpleDataType>st

Organization, Consolidation and Presentation of Financial Statements 
[Abstract]</Label></Row><Row 
FlagID="0"><Id>2</Id><IsAbstractGroupTitle>false</IsAbstractGroupTitle><LabelSep
arator>
</LabelSeparator><Level>2</Level><ElementName>us-
gaap_BusinessDescriptionAndBasisOfPresentationTextBlock</ElementName><ElementPre
fix>us-
gaap_</ElementPrefix><IsBaseElement>true</IsBaseElement><BalanceType>na</Balance
Type><PeriodType>duration</PeriodType><IsReportTitle>false</IsReportTitle><IsSeg
mentTitle>false</IsSegmentTitle><IsCalendarTitle>false</IsCalendarTitle><IsEquit
yPrevioslyReportedAsRow>false</IsEquityPrevioslyReportedAsRow><IsEquityAdjustmen
tRow>false</IsEquityAdjustmentRow><IsBeginningBalance>false</IsBeginningBalance>
<IsEndingBalance>false</IsEndingBalance><IsReverseSign>false</IsReverseSign><Foo
tnoteIndexer /><Cells><Cell FlagID="0" ContextID="From2013-04-01to2013-06-30" 
UnitID=""><Id>1</Id><IsNumeric>false</IsNumeric><IsRatio>false</IsRatio><Display
ZeroAsNone>false</DisplayZeroAsNone><NumericAmount>0</NumericAmount><RoundedNume
ricAmount>0</RoundedNumericAmount><NonNumbericText>&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Green River 
Resources Corp. (an Alberta, Canada
corporation) (&amp;#147;GRC&amp;#148;), formed on December 1, 2004, and its 
wholly owned subsidiary, Green River Resources, Inc. (a Utah
corporation) (&amp;#147;GRI&amp;#148;), formed on February 16, 2005, were formed
for the purpose of extracting oil from oil sands, oil
shale, and other similar types of naturally occurring hydrocarbons in a cost 
effective and environmentally safe manner. GRC completed
a merger with American Sands Energy Corp. (formerly Millstream Ventures, Inc.) 
(&amp;#147;ASEC&amp;#148;), a publicly traded company,
on June 3, 2011. The merger was accounted for as a reverse acquisition with GRC 
treated as the accounting acquirer.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;On December 31, 2011, GRC, a wholly owned non-operating
subsidiary of ASEC, was voluntarily dissolved under the Business Corporation Act
of the Province of Alberta, Canada. As a result
of the dissolution, ASEC assumed all of the outstanding stock of GRI which was 
the sole asset of GRC at the time of dissolution.
References to the &amp;#147;Company&amp;#148; refer to GRC and its wholly owned 
subsidiary, GRI, prior to the reverse merger on June
3, 2011, and GRC, GRI, and ASEC (the legal parent) subsequent to the reverse 
merger transaction until December 31, 2011, and GRI
and ASEC after December 31, 2011. The Company has not generated revenues from 
its principal operations and is a development stage
company.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;The Company has acquired rights to approximately
1,760 acres of prime oil sand deposits in the Sunnyside area of Utah. Prior to 
January 24, 2012, the Company had licensed proprietary
extraction technology with Bleeding Rock, LLC (&amp;#147;Bleeding 
Rock&amp;#148;), which had an exclusive license to a bitumen and hydrocarbon
extraction process to separate oil and other hydrocarbons from sand, dirt and 
other substances. Bleeding Rock is a significant
stockholder of the Company and is 50% owned in combination among the Chief 
Executive Officer of the Company and two of his relatives.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;Effective January 24, 2012, the Company entered
into a License, Development and Engineering Agreement with Universal Oil 
Recovery Corp. and SRS International (the &amp;#147;License
Agreement&amp;#148;) whereby the Company was granted an exclusive non-
transferable license to use certain technology in its proposed
business to extract bitumen from oil sands. The territory covered by the 
agreement includes the State of Utah and any other geographic
location in which a future designated project is commenced by or through the 
Company. In conjunction with the License Agreement,
the Company terminated its operating agreement with Bleeding Rock under which 
Bleeding Rock had licensed rights to use similar
technology to GRI. The License Agreement also designates the Company as an 
&amp;#147;authorized agent&amp;#148; in representing the owner
of the technology in future projects. The Chief Executive Officer, a director,
and principal stockholder of the Company, is an
owner and manager of Bleeding Rock.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;The License Agreement requires the licensing
parties to provide demonstration equipment for the process by which their 
proprietary solvent extracts bitumen from oil sands and
to demonstrate the process on up to 150 tons of oil sands. The term of the 
License Agreement is for 20 years and thereafter so
long as production of products using the technology is commercially and 
economically feasible.&lt;/p&gt;</NonNumbericText><FootnoteIndexer 
/><CurrencyCode /><CurrencySymbol 
/><IsIndependantCurrency>false</IsIndependantCurrency><ShowCurrencySymbol>false<
/ShowCurrencySymbol><DisplayDateInUSFormat>false</DisplayDateInUSFormat></Cell><
/Cells><ElementDataType>nonnum:textBlockItemType</ElementDataType><SimpleDataTyp
e>na</SimpleDataType><ElementDefenition>The entire disclosure for the business 
description and basis of presentation concepts.  Business description describes 
the nature and type of organization including but not limited to organizational 
structure as may be applicable to holding companies, parent and subsidiary 
relationships, business divisions, business units, business segments, affiliates
and information about significant ownership of the reporting entity.  Basis of 
presentation describes the underlying basis used to prepare the financial 
statements (for example, US Generally Accepted Accounting Principles, Other 
Comprehensive Basis of Accounting, 
IFRS).</ElementDefenition><ElementReferences>No definition 
available.</ElementReferences><IsTotalLabel>false</IsTotalLabel><UnitID>0</UnitI

Events<br></strong></div>

<tr>
        <th class="th">
          <div>Jun. 30, 2013</div>
        </th>
      </tr>
      <tr class="re">
        <td class="pl" style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 'defref_us-
gaap_CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureAbstract', 
window );"><strong>Commitments and Contingencies Disclosure 
[Abstract]</strong></a></td>
        <td class="text">&#xA0;<span></span></td>
      </tr>
      <tr class="ro">
        <td class="pl" style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 'defref_us-
gaap_SubsequentEventsTextBlock', window );">Note 12 - Subsequent Events</a></td>
        <td class="text"><p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
margin: 0; text-align: justify">On July 1, 2013, the Company entered into a
consulting contact with Great Bear, LLC (&#147;Great Bear&#148;) to provide 
corporate advisory and marketing services to the
Company. The contract calls for the Company to issue Great Bear 100,000 shares 
of restricted common stock as consideration for
the services to be provided and to pay a one-time $5,000 fee upon completion of 
an offering of at least $2,000,000. The term of
the agreement is for one year.</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify">Effective July 11, 2013, the Company entered
into a financial advisory agreement with Merriman Capital, Inc. 
(&#34;Merriman&#34;), a wholly owned subsidiary of Merriman Holdings,
Inc. (OTCQX: MERR). The Agreement is for a 12 month period and the Company has 
agreed to issue to Merriman 300,000 shares of restricted
common stock in consideration of its services. Under the Agreement, Merriman 
will advise the Company on strategic initiatives to
increase shareholder value, analyze the Company&#146;s operating projections and
market conditions and provide the Company with
recommendations for the proper positioning of the Company with potential 
investors. Merriman will also assist the Company in raising
its next round of capital. The Company has agreed that Merriman will have 
unlimited &#34;piggyback&#34; registration rights for
a period of three years after the issuance of the shares at the Company's 
expense (provided that such rights shall not apply to
a public offering of the Company&#146;s common stock upon any underwriter&#146;s
reasonable assertion in writing that the inclusion
of such stock in a public offering would materially impair the marketability of 
such public offering).</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in"><b>&#160;</b></p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify">In conjunction with the proposed fund raising
by Merriman, Hidden Peak Partners LLC has agreed to subordinate any debt owed to
Hidden Peak by the Company to any future debt
financing by the Company. Hidden Peak has also agreed in principal to convert 
its 5% Convertible Promissory Note dated January
24, 2012, into restricted common shares of the Company pursuant to the terms of 
such Note, subject to satisfactory tax analysis
that no federal or state income tax would be triggered on conversion of such 
note.</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify">Neither the shares proposed to be issued to
Merriman nor to Hidden Peak have been registered under the Securities Act and 
may not be offered or sold in the United States absent
registration or an applicable exemption from registration requirements.</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify">Effective July 11, 2013, the Company issued
each of its nonexecutive directors options to purchase 125,000 shares of common 
stock pursuant to the Company&#146;s 2011 Plan.
The exercise price of the options will be $0.35 and the options expire five 
years from the date of grant and vest 1/3 on the date
of grant, 1/3 on the first anniversary date and 1/3 on the 2<sup>nd</sup> 
anniversary date.</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify">On July 11, 2013, the Company issued to its
Chief Operating Officer an option to purchase 185,000 shares of the 
Company&#146;s common stock pursuant to the Company&#146;s
2011 Plan. The exercise price of the options will be $0.35 and the options 
expire five years from the date of grant and vest 1/3
on the date of grant, 1/3 on the first anniversary date and 1/3 on the 
2<sup>nd</sup> anniversary date.</p><span></span></td>
      </tr>

Definition</a><div>
                <p>The entire disclosure for significant events or transactions 
that occurred after the balance sheet date through the date the financial 
statements were issued or the date the financial statements were available to be
issued. Examples include: the sale of a capital stock issue, purchase of a 
business, settlement of litigation, catastrophic loss, significant foreign 
exchange rate changes, loans to insiders or affiliates, and transactions not in 
the ordinary course of business.</p>

    <div style="display: none;">
      <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_EarningsPerShareBasicAndDiluted">
        <tr>
          <td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
          <td>
            <div class="body" style="padding: 2px;"><a 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div>
                <p>The amount of net income or loss for the period per each 
share in instances when basic and diluted earnings per share are the same amount
and reported as a single line item on the face of the financial statements.  
Basic earnings per share is the amount of net income or loss for the period per 
each share of common stock or unit outstanding during the reporting period.  
Diluted earnings per share includes the amount of net income or loss for the 
period available to each share of common stock or common unit outstanding during
the reporting period and to each share or unit that would have been outstanding 
assuming the issuance of common shares or units for all dilutive potential 
common shares or units outstanding during the reporting period.</p>
              </div><a href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ References</a><div style="display: 
none;">
                <p>No definition available.</p>
              </div><a href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ Details</a><div style="display: none;">
                <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
                  <tr>
                    <td><strong> Name:</strong></td>
                    <td><nobr>us-
gaap_EarningsPerShareBasicAndDiluted</nobr></td>
                  </tr>
                  <tr>
                    <td style="padding-right: 4px;"><nobr><strong> Namespace 
Prefix:</strong></nobr></td>
                    <td>us-gaap_</td>
                  </tr>
                  <tr>
                    <td><strong> Data Type:</strong></td>
                    <td>num:perShareItemType</td>
                  </tr>
                  <tr>
                    <td><strong> Balance Type:</strong></td>
                    <td>na</td>
                  </tr>
                  <tr>
                    <td><strong> Period Type:</strong></td>
                    <td>duration</td>
                  </tr>
                </table>
              </div>
            </div>
          </td>
        </tr>

href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">-

taxes, which is attributable to the parent.</p>

      <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_ResearchAndDevelopmentExpense">
        <tr>
          <td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
          <td>
            <div class="body" style="padding: 2px;"><a 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div>
                <p>The aggregate costs incurred (1) in a planned search or 
critical investigation aimed at discovery of new knowledge with the hope that 
such knowledge will be useful in developing a new product or service, a new 
process or technique, or in bringing about a significant improvement to an 
existing product or process; or (2) to translate research findings or other 
knowledge into a plan or design for a new product or process or for a 
significant improvement to an existing product or process whether intended for 
sale or the entity's use, during the reporting period charged to research and 
development projects, including the costs of developing computer software up to 
the point in time of achieving technological feasibility, and costs allocated in
accounting for a business combination to in-process projects deemed to have no 
alternative future use.</p>
              </div><a href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ References</a><div style="display: 
none;">

      <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-
gaap_SellingGeneralAndAdministrativeExpense">
        <tr>
          <td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
          <td>
            <div class="body" style="padding: 2px;"><a 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div>
                <p>The aggregate total costs related to selling a firm's product
and services, as well as all other general and administrative expenses. Direct 
selling expenses (for example, credit, warranty, and advertising) are expenses 
that can be directly linked to the sale of specific products. Indirect selling 
expenses are expenses that cannot be directly linked to the sale of specific 
products, for example telephone expenses, Internet, and postal charges. General 
and administrative expenses include salaries of non-sales personnel, rent, 
utilities, communication, etc.</p>
              </div><a href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ References</a><div style="display: 
none;">
                <p>Reference 1: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br><br> -Publisher FASB<br><br>

      <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-
gaap_WeightedAverageNumberOfSharesOutstandingBasic">
        <tr>
          <td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
          <td>
            <div class="body" style="padding: 2px;"><a 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div>
                <p>Number of [basic] shares or units, after adjustment for 
contingently issuable shares or units and other shares or units not deemed 
outstanding, determined by relating the portion of time within a reporting 
period that common shares or units have been outstanding to the total time in 
that period.</p>
              </div><a href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ References</a><div style="display: 
none;">
                <p>Reference 1: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br><br> -Publisher FASB<br><br> 
-Name Accounting Standards Codification<br><br> -Topic 260<br><br> -SubTopic 
10<br><br> -Section 50<br><br> -Paragraph 1<br><br> -Subparagraph (a)<br><br>

<TEXT>
<html>
  <head>
    <META http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=us-ascii">
    <link rel="StyleSheet" type="text/css" href="report.css"><script 
type="text/javascript" src="Show.js">/* Do Not Remove This Comment 
*/</script></head>
  <body><span style="display: none;">v2.4.0.8</span><table class="report" 
border="0" cellspacing="2" id="ID0ELE">
      <tr>
        <th class="tl" colspan="1" rowspan="2">
          <div style="width: 200px;"><strong>5. Mineral 
Leases<br></strong></div>
        </th>
        <th class="th" colspan="1">3 Months Ended</th>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <th class="th">
          <div>Jun. 30, 2013</div>
        </th>
      </tr>
      <tr class="re">
        <td class="pl" style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 
'defref_AMSE_MineralLeasesAbstract', window );"><strong>Mineral 
Leases</strong></a></td>
        <td class="text">&#xA0;<span></span></td>
      </tr>
      <tr class="ro">
        <td class="pl" style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 'defref_us-
gaap_MineralIndustriesDisclosuresTextBlock', window );">Note 5 - Mineral 
Leases</a></td>
        <td class="text"><p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
margin: 0; text-align: justify">During 2005, the Company acquired three oil
sands mineral leases: (1) an undivided 40% interest in an 1,120-acre parcel, (2)
an undivided 20% interest in the same 1,120-acre
parcel, and (3) an undivided 16.666% interest in a 640-acre parcel. These leases
are located in Carbon County, Utah, have a 6-year
life, and require minimum yearly lease payments totaling $224,597. Effective 
March 31, 2013, the lease terms were extended through
2016 and the annual lease payments increased to $268,915.</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify">In 2009, a fourth lease was entered into with
William G. Gibbs, a relative of the Chief Executive Officer of the Company, for 
an additional undivided 5% interest in the 640-acre
parcel (for a total 21.666% undivided interest in the 640-acre parcel). This 
lease is located in Carbon County, Utah, adjacent
to the 1,120-acre parcel. This lease has a 6-year life with a minimum yearly 
lease payment of $7,965 and is scheduled to terminate
by October 2015 if the property has not reached commercial production. Effective
March 31, 2013, the payment due date for this
lease was extended to July 31, 2013 from January 1, 2013. Effective, July 31, 
2013, the lease payment was extended again until
September 30, 2013.</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify">The Company&#146;s interest in these leases
is conditioned upon the payments of royalties, minimum yearly investment in 
development, tax payments, and other obligations to
the owners of the leases.</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in"><b>&#160;</b></p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify">Upon commencement of operations, each lease
requires a production royalty of 10% of the market value of the minerals sold, 
net of applicable costs and expenses. The Company
has the right, but not the obligation, to pool or unitize the leases, such that 
the ore mined is allocated between, and the royalties
paid, on their proportionate interests. If not pooled, the owners will be paid 
royalties only to the extent the oil sand ore is
mined on their respective property. Through June 30, 2013, no production 
royalties were accrued or paid because production on these
properties had not commenced. After three consecutive calendar years of 
production on the 1,120-acre parcel, the production royalty
on the 1,120-acre parcel shall be the greater of the 10% royalty or $1,000,000 
annually.</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify">Future minimum lease payments are as follows
for the years ending:</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify; text-indent: 0.5in">&#160;</p>
<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">
<tr style="vertical-align: bottom">
    <td><font style="font-size: 8pt; color: black"><u>June 30,</u></font></td>
